item.title: Coffee to Code Conversion Success
item.description:
Excited to announce that I’ve successfully turned coffee into code for the 1,847th consecutive day! üéâ

Key achievements:

‚úÖ Fixed a bug I created yesterday ‚úÖ Googled “how to center a div” for the 500th time ‚úÖ Told my manager “it’ll be done by end of day” (it wasn’t) ‚úÖ Named a variable “thing2” because “thing” was taken

#DevLife #AlwaysLearning #SeniorDeveloper

item.title: The 7 Stages of Programming
item.description:
After 6 years of experience, I can confidently say that 90% of programming is:

  1. Writing code
  2. Deleting that code
  3. Copying someone else’s code
  4. Googling why that code doesn’t work
  5. Adding console.log() everywhere
  6. Crying
  7. Repeat

Currently accepting speaking engagements at conferences. Topic: “It Works on My Machine: A Memoir”

item.title: Portfolio Highlights
item.description:
PORTFOLIO HIGHLIGHTS üöÄ

üèÜ Successfully blamed 47 bugs on “user error” üèÜ Created a loading spinner so good, users forgot what they were waiting for üèÜ Master of the “Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V” keyboard shortcut üèÜ Expert at writing TODO comments I’ll never revisit üèÜ Proficient in pretending I understand blockchain

Tech Stack: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Coffee, Anxiety, Stack Overflow Premium

Open to opportunities where “rockstar ninja” is in the job title!

item.title: New Certification Completed!
item.description:
I’m thrilled to share that I’ve completed another certification!

üìú “Introduction to Ignoring Documentation and Learning the Hard Way”

Course highlights: ‚Ä¢ Module 1: Why Read Docs When You Can Experiment? ‚Ä¢ Module 2: Advanced Console.log() Debugging Techniques ‚Ä¢ Module 3: The Art of Stack Overflow Navigation ‚Ä¢ Module 4: Deploying to Production on Friday Afternoons

Huge thanks to my mentors: Imposter Syndrome and Caffeine Addiction. Couldn’t have done it without you!
